titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. R. C. Harris, Indictment
CWG4677

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky.
County of Marion Sct

Be it remembered that at a Circuit Court begun and held at the Court House in the town of Lebanon within and for the County of Marion aforesaid on the 4th Monday in November AD 1863 among others the following ordered were duly Entered of Record to wit.

Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment for Tipling house No 17 --
R. C. Harris.

The Plaintiff appeared by atty and the Deft in person and in open Court waived the right of Trial and plead guilty to the charge contained in the indictment. it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Plff recover of the Deft the Sum of Sixty Dollars and cost herein Expended.

A Copy attest.
F. B. Merimee. Clk.

Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment for Tippling house No 24
J. G. Campbell / A. S. Wade

The Plaintiff appeared by atty and the Deft in person and in open Court waived the right of Trial and plead guilty to the charge constained in the indictment: it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Plff recover of the Deft the sum of Sixty Dollars and cost herein Expended.

A Copy attest.
F. B. Merimee Clk

Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment for Tippling house No 26
George W. Graves

The Plaintiff appeared by atty and the Deft in person and in open Court waived the right of Trial and plead guilty to the charge contained in the indictment, it is therefore adjudged by the court that the Plff recover of the Deft the sum of Sixty Dollars and cost herein expended.
A Copy attest F. B. Merimee Clk

Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment Tippling House No 20
J. G. Campbell

The Plaintiff appeared by attorney and the Deft in person and in open Court waived the right of Trial and plead guilty to the charge contained in the indictment; it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Plaintiff recover of the Deft the sum of Sixty Dollars and cost herein expended.

A Copy attest.
F. B. Merimee Clk

Marion Cir Court
vs
G. W. Graves
Respite 12 mos
Tho E Bramlette
John G. Campbell
2 Judgts
R. C. Harris
Nov term 1863
Respited
9th Feby 1862
156-1293
